Mayerhofer.png | imagesize = | name = Alexander Roda Roda | birth_name = Šandor Friedrich Rosenfeld | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1872|04|13}} | birth_place = [[Drnovice]], [[Austria-Hungary|Austro-Hungarian Monarchy]] (now [[Czech Republic]]) | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1945|08|20|1872|04|13}} | death_place = [[New York City]], [[New York]], [[United States]] | relations = | alma_mater = | othername = | occupation = [[Writer]] | yearsactive = | nationality = }} '''Alexander Roda Roda''' (born ''Šandor Friedrich Rosenfeld''; April 13, 1872 – August 20, 1945) was [[Austria]]n-[[Croatia]]n [[writer]]. ==Biography== Roda Roda was born in [[Drnovice]], [[Moravia]] on April 13, 1872. As a child, he moved with his family to [[Slavonia]]. He changed his name from Šandor to Alexander, and his surname from Rosenfeld to Roda Roda. Roda is the [[Croatia]]n word for [[stork]]. He chose his new surname because storks nested on the chimney of his house in [[Osijek]]. He spent more than 30 years living and working in Osijek and Slavonia.<ref name=essekeri>{{cite news|url=http://essekeri.hr/bio/47-alexander-roda|title=Biografija: Alexander Roda Roda|publisher=Essekeri|work=essekeri.hr|language=Croatian}}</ref> In 1902, Roda Roda quit the military career and became a journalist (during [[World War I]] he was war correspondent); he contributed to "Simplicissimus". In 1938, he emigrated in the USA. He wrote many comedies (Der König von Crucina, 1892; Bubi, 1912, with G. Meyrink), tales and novels (''Soldatengeschichten'', 2 vol., 1904; Der Ehegarten, 1913, Der Schnaps, der Rauchtabak und die verfluchte Liebe, 1908; Die Panduren, 1935) and autobiographical books (''Irrfahrten eines Humoristen 1914–1919'', 1920; ''Roda Rodas Roman'', 1925). He died in [[New York]]. Until his death, Roda Roda considered Osijek as his hometown.<ref name=essekeri/> ==Bibliography== *1892 – "Der Gutsherr von Ljublin" *1906 – "Eines Esels Kinnbacken" *1908 – "Von Bienen, Drohnen und
